title: Andrew Tan
meta_description: #13 Andrew Tan on the 2024 Philippines 50 Richest
main_content: PROFILE Andrew Tan $1.5B $59M (3.73%) Real Time Net Worth as of 3/1/25 Reflects change since 5 pm ET of prior trading day. #2110 in the world today Photo by Kevin Icabales/Alliance Global From the Editor Andrew Tan is the chairman of Alliance Global, a holding company with interests in food and beverage, gaming, hospitality and real estate. The son of a factory worker, Tan built his fortune developing large apartment complexes around Manila. Alliance Global runs Emperador, the world's largest brandy company by sales volume. Tan's son Kevin is chief executive of Alliance Global and chief strategy officer of property developer Megaworld. Megaworld is investing 350 billion pesos ($6.3 billion) from 2023 to 2028 to build townships across the Philippines. Wealth History HOVER TO REVEAL NET WORTH BY YEAR Forbes Lists #13 Philippines 50 Richest (2024) #1623 Billionaires (2024) Personal Stats Age 73 Source of Wealth Diversified, Self Made Residence Manila, Philippines Citizenship Philippines Marital Status Married Children 4 Education Bachelor of Arts/Science, University of the East Did you know Tan's father splurged on a bottle of brandy at Tan's graduation from the University of the East in 1974; that was Tan's first time trying brandy. Related People & Companies Sam Goi Related by financial asset: Keppel-KBS US REIT View Profile Novo Nordisk Holds stake in Novo Nordisk View Profile Philippines Citizen of Philippines View Profile John Lim Related by financial asset: ESR-LOGOS REIT View Profile Gordon & Celine Tang Related by financial asset: Cromwell European REIT View Profile Mukesh Ambani Related by origin of wealth: Diversified View Profile See More See Less More on Forbes Feb 3, 2025 Philippine Tycoon Andrew Tan’s Emperador Buys Mezcal Distiller To Boost Spirits Business Emperador—the liquor arm of billionaire Andrew Tan’s Alliance Global—has bought a majority stake in Mexico’s Destileria Los Danzantes, expanding its liquor portfolio with the addition of Mezcal brands. By Ian Sayson Forbes Staff Oct 14, 2024 Billionaire Tan To Spend $261 Million On Project In Philippines’ North Philippine spirits and property tycoon Andrew Tan will build a luxury resort and township in Laoag, a provincial capital 488 kilometers north of Manila, in anticipatio... By Ian Sayson Forbes Staff Sep 17, 2024 Philippine Tycoon Andrew Tan To Invest $700 Million In Boracay, Cebu Casino Projects Spirits and property tycoon Andrew Tan will spend about $700 million in its casino projects in the central Philippine islands of Boracay and Cebu to tap into the tourism boom. By Ian Sayson Forbes Staff Aug 5, 2024 Billionaires Andrew Tan, Binod Chaudhary Team Up For Philippine Luxury Resort Philippine tycoon Andrew Tan and Nepalese billionaire Binod Chaudhary will develop a $208 million luxury resort and township in Batangas, south of Manila. By Ian Sayson Forbes Staff Apr 21, 2024 Meet The Billionaire Betting Big On An Idyllic Island Retreat In The Philippines Inside Andrew Tan's $720 million eco-tourism project in the country’s pristine beachside paradise. By Jonathan Burgos Forbes Staff Jun 18, 2023 Billionaire Andrew Tan’s Megaworld To Invest $6.3 Billion On Philippine Townships, Hotels In Next Five Years Megaworld is investing 350 billion pesos over the next five years to build townships across the Philippines, betting the country’s economic recovery will continue amid a revival in tourism and consumer spending. By Jonathan Burgos Forbes Staff May 31, 2023 Billionaire Andrew Tan’s Alliance Global Buys Out Genting’s Stake In Philippine Casino Alliance Global Group said Tuesday it has agreed to buy the 40% stake held by its financially troubled partner Genting Hong Kong in their joint venture company, Travellers International, owner of Newport World Resorts hotel and casino in Manila. By Jonathan Burgos Forbes Staff Dec 12, 2022 Filipino Billionaire Andrew Tan To List Emperador Properties On Spain’s Bourse At $1 Billion Valuation Real estate and spirits billionaire Andrew Tan is listing his privately held Emperador Properties on the Spanish bourse, becoming the first Filipino-owned company to do so. By Jonathan Burgos Forbes Staff Oct 13, 2022 Billionaire Andrew Tan Boosts $970 Million Spanish Property Portfolio With New Shopping Mall In Madrid Andrew Tan is expanding his privately held real estate portfolio in Spain with the recent opening of the group’s first overseas shopping mall in Madrid. By Jonathan Burgos Forbes Staff Jul 13, 2022 Philippine Billionaire Andrew Tan’s Emperador To Accelerate Global Expansion After SGX Listing Emperador—controlled by billionaire Andrew Tan—will start trading tomorrow on the Singapore Exchange as the Philippine liquor giant seeks to broaden its investor base to bankroll its international expansion plans. By Jonathan Burgos Forbes Staff Jun 16, 2022 Tycoon Andrew Tan’s Alliance Global Spending $1 Billion To Expand Property, Other Businesses Alliance Global Group Inc. is budgeting 60 billion pesos ($1.1 billion) in capital expenditures this year to expand its real estate, distillery and fast food chain operations amid signs the economy is recovering from the pandemic-induced slowdown in the past two years. By Jonathan Burgos Forbes Staff Jun 9, 2022 Philippine Developer Megaworld Boosts Capital Spending To $945 Million Real estate developer Megaworld Corp, owned by Filipino billionaire Andrew Tan, allocates 50 billion pesos ($945 million) for capital expenditure this year, as per the company’s statement on Monday. By Gloria Haraito Forbes Staff Oct 6, 2021 Philippine Tycoon Andrew Tan’s Megaworld To Build $1.9 Billion Business District North Of Manila Megaworld said Wednesday it will invest $1.9 billion to build a suburban business district in the province of Bulacan, about 26 kilometers north of the Philippine capital of Manila. By Jonathan Burgos Forbes Staff Sep 20, 2021 Andrew Tan’s Megaworld To Invest $797 Million In Palawan Township, Betting On Tourism Rebound Megaworld—controlled by billionaire Andrew Tan—said Monday it will invest 40 billion pesos ($797 million) to develop an “eco-tourism township” in the southwestern Philippine island of Palawan, betting on a robust recovery in the leisure travel market amid the increasing rollout of Covid-19 vaccines. By Jonathan Burgos Forbes Staff Sep 10, 2021 Philippine Tycoon Andrew Tan’s Megaworld Cuts MREIT IPO Price, Size As Investors Seek Higher Yield Megaworld—controlled by billionaire Andrew Tan—has lowered the price and size of the planned initial public offering of its office real estate invest trust, reducing proceeds from the IPO to 15.3 billion pesos ($307 million) as investors seek higher yields. By Jonathan Burgos Forbes Staff Jun 17, 2021 Philippine Tycoon Andrew Tan’s Megaworld Seeks $565.5 Million From Call Center REIT Listing Megaworld—the developer controlled by billionaire Andrew Tan—is spinning off some of its office properties into a real estate investment trust that would raise 27.3 billion pesos ($565.5 million) from an initial public offering, joining the IPO bandwagon of other real estate tycoons. By Jonathan Burgos Forbes Staff More Articles also on forbes Philippine Tycoon Andrew Tan’s Emperador Buys Mezcal Distiller To Boost Spirits Business Billionaire Tan To Spend $261 Million On Project In Philippines’ North Philippine Tycoon Andrew Tan To Invest $700 Million In Boracay, Cebu Casino Projects
